page.title: 01Land north of Kingsburgh
page.content: Main road of Northern Skye goes through top part of this area. Not the original road - new one was built to accommodate 2 lanes of traffic. Much of the area is undulating moorland from the main road down to the shore of Loch Snizart Beag. Across the loch is Lyndale Point - baren moorland with a couple of small inland lochs. Much of the area is uninhabited. The only settlement in the area is part of Kingsburgh, but many of the houses are in ruins and crofts (system where land was split into regular plots and rented out to families) no longer worked. Much of the land used as rough grazing for sheep. Forestry encroaches on this area - not natural but specially planted by the Forestry commission.
